intro: Sedum telephium var. rubrum, commonly known as Crimson Bladder Campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, pink to crimson flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or coastal environments. It is a perennial species that thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant. The flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
